question_sentence: A British think tank this week suggested the government could reduce loneliness by offering subsidies for what?
evidence: Research by the Centre for Social Justice found that married couples were the least likely to report feeling lonely, but a majority of low-income people said they were priced out of getting hitched. The think tank suggested a government subsidy of up to £550 to cover the basic costs.

question_sentence: What type of ape became the first wild animal reported to have tended to a wound with a substance known to have medicinal properties?
evidence: Rakus, a Sumatran orangutan, was observed chewing and applying juice from the akar kuning, or yellow root, plant to a wound on his face, then using the chewed leaves like a bandage. A month later the wound had completely healed.

question_sentence: Which institution this week announced that it was changing its name to be more inclusive?
evidence: The organisation will now be known as Scouting America, 114 years since it was founded. Britain's equivalent, The Scout Association, dropped the 'Boy' from its name in 1967.

question_sentence: Which country this week halted all trade with Israel?
evidence: Turkey has suspended all trade with Israel over the "worsening humanitarian tragedy" in Gaza. It will join South Africa's genocide case against Israel at the International Court of Justice until the Israeli government "allows an uninterrupted and sufficient flow of humanitarian aid to Gaza".

question_sentence: Which country reportedly hacked the UK's Ministry of Defence and accessed details of armed forces personnel?
evidence: The breach targeted a third-party payroll system containing personal data of about 270,000 military personnel, including regulars, reservists and veterans. China has denied any involvement.

question_sentence: Which US state is poised to become the 13th to ban child marriage?
evidence: Governor Chris Sununu is considering whether to sign a bill passed by state representatives that would raise the minimum age for marriage to 18. Find out more about the growing movement to end child marriage in the US on the latest episode of The Week Unwrapped.

question_sentence: A new Ipsos poll found what percentage of Brits have a favourable impression of the royal family?
evidence: The same percentage told the Ipsos survey they had a positive impression of the King. However, he came only third in the royal popularity stakes behind the Prince and Princess of Wales, both of whom had a favourability rating of 69%.

question_sentence: What is the name of Panama's newly elected president?
evidence: José Raúl Mulino won Panama’s presidency as a last-minute stand-in for former President Ricardo Martinelli after he was convicted of money laundering and sentenced to five years in prison. Martinelli has been campaigning for Mulino from inside the Nicaraguan Embassy, where he was granted asylum.

question_sentence: Drake appeared to call an end to his two-week rap feud with fellow superstar Kendrick Lamar on Sunday with a track titled what?
evidence: A play on Lamar's series of "Heart" tracks, Drake's latest salvo contained the line "I don't wanna diss you anymore" – perhaps because rap tastemakers have conclusively judged Lamar the winner of the sometimes brutal war of words.

question_sentence: US presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr claimed that what caused him to have memory loss?
evidence: In a newly reported divorce case deposition from 2012, independent presidential candidate Kennedy disclosed previously unreported health issues. He claimed his mental fogginess was the result of mercury poisoning and a parasitic "worm that got into my brain and ate a portion of it and then died".

question_sentence: What is the name of the Boeing spacecraft that had its launch delayed this week?
evidence: The long-awaited first crewed mission of Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft was delayed Monday after engineers identified a valve issue that halted launch preparations.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden warned he may stop sending American weapons to which country?
evidence: President Joe Biden told CNN he would halt some shipments of American weapons to Israel if Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered a major invasion of the Gazan city of Rafah. This comes as Israel continues to defy international pressure to limit its military campaign in the city, where more than a million Palestinian civilians have been sheltering.

question_sentence: The 150th Kentucky Derby ended in a dramatic photo finish recently. Which famed venue has been the home of the race since 1875?
evidence: The Kentucky Derby, held annually at Churchill Downs in Louisville, has become the longest continuously held sporting event in the US. A crowd of 10,000 people watched the first race in 1875. This year, over 150,000 entered the famed venue to revel in the celebrations.

question_sentence: Which member of the House of Representatives was spared from losing his leadership position this week?
evidence: House Speaker Mike Johnson will keep his job after Democrats voted with the majority of Republicans on Wednesday to kill an effort by GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene to oust him.

question_sentence: The CDC launched new rules for bringing which animal into the US?
evidence: The CDC announced it is updating its rules for bringing dogs into the US in an effort to keep the country free of canine rabies.

question_sentence: Which organization announced that it plans to change its name more than 100 years after it was established?
evidence: The Boy Scouts of America is changing its name to Scouting America. The youth organization said the new name is meant to help everyone, including boys and girls, feel welcome.

question_sentence: Which type of medical device was recently impacted by a widespread technical issue?
evidence: More than 200 people with diabetes were injured when their insulin pumps shut down unexpectedly due to a problem with a connected mobile app, the FDA said.

question_sentence: Which event is known as fashion’s biggest night of the year?
evidence: Celebrities save their most creative outfits for the annual Met Gala — also known as fashion’s biggest night. The lavish event was held Monday in New York City.

question_sentence: Which company is withdrawing its Covid-19 vaccine, citing low demand?
evidence: AstraZeneca is withdrawing its Covid-19 vaccine, citing the availability of a plethora of new shots that has led to a decline in demand.

question_sentence: Which athlete was named the NBA's Most Valuable Player?
evidence: Denver Nuggets star center Nikola Jokić was named the NBA's Most Valuable Player on Wednesday, marking the third time he has been awarded the honor in four seasons.

question_sentence: Who were the two men arrested in connection with the shooting of Camay De Silva at Delaware State University?
What are some of the proposed regulations for the short-term rental market in Wilmington?
choices: Instituting a tax on short-term rentals
Making short-term rental units only a secondary use for the property

question_sentence: What is the significance of the Point-to-Point event at Winterthur Museum, Garden & Library?
choices: It is a tailgating and horse racing event

question_sentence: What happened to the fin whale that beached itself at Delaware Seashore State Park?
choices: The whale was rescued and returned to the ocean
The whale died overnight after beaching itself.
The whale was relocated to another beach.

question_sentence: Why did Julianne Murray, the Delaware GOP chair, decide not to run for governor?
choices: She decided to run for a different political office.
She wanted to ensure “party unity and organizational strength.”
She was not eligible to run for governor.

question_sentence: What are the three items now being sold at Fusco’s Water Ice, a 67-year-old Delaware tradition?
choices: Water ice, Soft serve ice cream, and Fresh-baked tomato pie
Water ice, Hot dogs, and Fresh-baked tomato pie
Water ice, French fries, and Fresh-baked tomato pie

question_sentence: What significant achievements did Ethan Walther and Isabelle Walsh accomplish in their running careers?
choices: Ethan Walther set a new Delaware state record in the 800-meter race, and Isabelle Walsh became the second-fastest indoor miler in state history.
Ethan Walther won a lacrosse championship, and Isabelle Walsh won a figure skating competition.
Ethan Walther and Isabelle Walsh both won the cross-country state meet in their respective divisions.

question_sentence: What is the main concern raised in the article about the use of University of Delaware (UD) facilities for high school championships?
choices: The UD facilities are not large enough to accommodate the crowds at high school championships.
The cost of renting UD facilities for high school championships has been increasing significantly.
The UD facilities do not have the necessary equipment for certain sports.

question_sentence: Which three Delaware towns were featured in the list of “America’s 100 Most Charming Main Streets” according to the Mixbook survey?
What is happening to the Giant Heart exhibit at the Franklin Institute in Philadelphia?
choices: The Giant Heart exhibit is being replaced with a new exhibit on the human body.
The Giant Heart exhibit is being moved to a different location within the Franklin Institute
The Giant Heart exhibit is being temporarily closed for renovations and will reopen as part of a larger exhibit focused on the human body.
